commit.message:
configure.in: Add AC_TYPE_GETGROUPS test.

        * configure.in: Add AC_TYPE_GETGROUPS test.
        * sys-protos.h: Use GETGROUPS_T * for second arg of getgroups.
        * configure: Rebuilt.

From-SVN: r34524

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,9 @@
+2000-06-13  J. David Anglin  <dave@hiauly1.hia.nrc.ca>
+
+	* configure.in: Add AC_TYPE_GETGROUPS test.
+	* sys-protos.h: Use GETGROUPS_T * for second arg of getgroups.
+	* configure: Rebuilt.
+
 2000-06-13  Richard Henderson  <rth@cygnus.com>
 
 	* explow.c (set_mem_attributes): Do nothing for NULL type.

@@ -2538,13 +2538,119 @@ EOF
 fi
 
 
+echo $ac_n "checking for uid_t in sys/types.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
+echo "configure:2543: checking for uid_t in sys/types.h" >&5
+if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_uid_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
+  echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
+else
+  cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
+#line 2548 "configure"
+#include "confdefs.h"
+#include <sys/types.h>
+EOF
+if (eval "$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext") 2>&5 |
+  egrep "uid_t" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
+  rm -rf conftest*
+  ac_cv_type_uid_t=yes
+else
+  rm -rf conftest*
+  ac_cv_type_uid_t=no
+fi
+rm -f conftest*
+
+fi
+
+echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_type_uid_t" 1>&6
+if test $ac_cv_type_uid_t = no; then
+  cat >> confdefs.h <<\EOF
+#define uid_t int
+EOF
+
+  cat >> confdefs.h <<\EOF
+#define gid_t int
+EOF
+
+fi
+
+echo $ac_n "checking type of array argument to getgroups""... $ac_c" 1>&6
+echo "configure:2577: checking type of array argument to getgroups" >&5
+if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_getgroups'+set}'`\" = set"; then
+  echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
+else
+  if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
+  ac_cv_type_getgroups=cross
+else
+  cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
+#line 2585 "configure"
+#include "confdefs.h"
+
+/* Thanks to Mike Rendell for this test.  */
+#include <sys/types.h>
+#define NGID 256
+#undef MAX
+#define MAX(x, y) ((x) > (y) ? (x) : (y))
+main()
+{
+  gid_t gidset[NGID];
+  int i, n;
+  union { gid_t gval; long lval; }  val;
+
+  val.lval = -1;
+  for (i = 0; i < NGID; i++)
+    gidset[i] = val.gval;
+  n = getgroups (sizeof (gidset) / MAX (sizeof (int), sizeof (gid_t)) - 1,
+                 gidset);
+  /* Exit non-zero if getgroups seems to require an array of ints.  This
+     happens when gid_t is short but getgroups modifies an array of ints.  */
+  exit ((n > 0 && gidset[n] != val.gval) ? 1 : 0);
+}
+
+EOF
+if { (eval echo configure:2610: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+then
+    ac_cv_type_getgroups=gid_t
+else
+  echo "configure: failed program was:" >&5
+  cat conftest.$ac_ext >&5
+  rm -fr conftest*
+  ac_cv_type_getgroups=int
+fi
+rm -fr conftest*
+fi
+
+if test $ac_cv_type_getgroups = cross; then
+        cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
+#line 2624 "configure"
+#include "confdefs.h"
+#include <unistd.h>
+EOF
+if (eval "$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext") 2>&5 |
+  egrep "getgroups.*int.*gid_t" >/dev/null 2>&1; then
+  rm -rf conftest*
+  ac_cv_type_getgroups=gid_t
+else
+  rm -rf conftest*
+  ac_cv_type_getgroups=int
+fi
+rm -f conftest*
+
+fi
+fi
+
+echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_type_getgroups" 1>&6
+cat >> confdefs.h <<EOF
+#define GETGROUPS_T $ac_cv_type_getgroups
+EOF
+
+
+
 echo $ac_n "checking for vprintf""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2543: checking for vprintf" >&5
+echo "configure:2649: checking for vprintf" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_vprintf'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2548 "configure"
+#line 2654 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char vprintf(); below.  */
@@ -2567,7 +2673,7 @@ vprintf();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2571: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2677: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_vprintf=yes"
 else
@@ -2591,12 +2697,12 @@ fi
 
 if test "$ac_cv_func_vprintf" != yes; then
 echo $ac_n "checking for _doprnt""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2595: checking for _doprnt" >&5
+echo "configure:2701: checking for _doprnt" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func__doprnt'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2600 "configure"
+#line 2706 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char _doprnt(); below.  */
@@ -2619,7 +2725,7 @@ _doprnt();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2623: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2729: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func__doprnt=yes"
 else
@@ -2655,15 +2761,15 @@ fi
 
 
 echo $ac_n "checking whether the printf functions support %p""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2659: checking whether the printf functions support %p" >&5
+echo "configure:2765: checking whether the printf functions support %p" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_func_printf_ptr'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   gcc_cv_func_printf_ptr=no
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2667 "configure"
+#line 2773 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <stdio.h>
 
@@ -2676,7 +2782,7 @@ int main()
   return (p != q);
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2680: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:2786: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   gcc_cv_func_printf_ptr=yes
 else
@@ -2709,12 +2815,12 @@ case "${host}" in
   ;;
 esac
 echo $ac_n "checking for pid_t""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2713: checking for pid_t" >&5
+echo "configure:2819: checking for pid_t" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_type_pid_t'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2718 "configure"
+#line 2824 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <sys/types.h>
 #if STDC_HEADERS
@@ -2743,17 +2849,17 @@ fi
 
 ac_safe=`echo "vfork.h" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for vfork.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2747: checking for vfork.h" >&5
+echo "configure:2853: checking for vfork.h" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2752 "configure"
+#line 2858 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <vfork.h>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:2757: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:2863: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -2778,18 +2884,18 @@ else
 fi
 
 echo $ac_n "checking for working vfork""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2782: checking for working vfork" >&5
+echo "configure:2888: checking for working vfork" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_vfork_works'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   if test "$cross_compiling" = yes; then
   echo $ac_n "checking for vfork""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2788: checking for vfork" >&5
+echo "configure:2894: checking for vfork" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_vfork'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2793 "configure"
+#line 2899 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char vfork(); below.  */
@@ -2812,7 +2918,7 @@ vfork();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2816: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:2922: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_vfork=yes"
 else
@@ -2834,7 +2940,7 @@ fi
 ac_cv_func_vfork_works=$ac_cv_func_vfork
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2838 "configure"
+#line 2944 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 /* Thanks to Paul Eggert for this test.  */
 #include <stdio.h>
@@ -2929,7 +3035,7 @@ main() {
   }
 }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:2933: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
+if { (eval echo configure:3039: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null
 then
   ac_cv_func_vfork_works=yes
 else
@@ -2955,17 +3061,17 @@ for ac_hdr in unistd.h
 do
 ac_safe=`echo "$ac_hdr" | sed 'y%./+-%__p_%'`
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_hdr""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2959: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
+echo "configure:3065: checking for $ac_hdr" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_header_$ac_safe'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
-#line 2964 "configure"
+#line 3070 "configure"
 #include "confdefs.h"
 #include <$ac_hdr>
 EOF
 ac_try="$ac_cpp conftest.$ac_ext >/dev/null 2>conftest.out"
-{ (eval echo configure:2969: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
+{ (eval echo configure:3075: \"$ac_try\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_try) 2>&5; }
 ac_err=`grep -v '^ *+' conftest.out | grep -v "^conftest.${ac_ext}\$"`
 if test -z "$ac_err"; then
   rm -rf conftest*
@@ -2994,12 +3100,12 @@ done
 for ac_func in getpagesize
 do
 echo $ac_n "checking for $ac_func""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:2998: checking for $ac_func" >&5
+echo "configure:3104: checking for $ac_func" >&5
 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_func_$ac_func'+set}'`\" = set"; then

   cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF

 /* System header to define __stub macros and hopefully few prototypes,
     which can conflict with char $ac_func(); below.  */
@@ -3022,7 +3128,7 @@ $ac_func();
 
 ; return 0; }
 EOF
-if { (eval echo configure:3026: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+if { (eval echo configure:3132: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
   rm -rf conftest*
   eval "ac_cv_func_$ac_func=yes"

 /* Test by Zack Weinberg.  Modified from MMAP_ANYWHERE test by

 }

+if { (eval echo configure:3312: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext} && (./conftest; exit) 2>/dev/null

 do

 echo $ac_n "checking whether $ac_func is declared""... $ac_c" 1>&6
-echo "configure:3239: checking whether $ac_func is declared" >&5

 strerror()

 if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_c_const'+set}'`\" = set"; then

 # for constant arguments.  Useless!
 echo $ac_n "checking for working alloca.h""... $ac_c" 1>&6
